---
title: "WebBook - Course Notes"
---

The WebBook is the main component of your course - a searchable, interactive online textbook built with Quarto.

## Structure

```
WebBook/
├── _quarto.yml          # Configuration
├── index.qmd            # Home page
├── assets/              # Images, CSS, JS
├── Module1/             # Your content
│   ├── lecture1.qmd
│   └── exercises.qmd
└── Notebooks/           # Jupyter notebooks
    └── analysis.ipynb
```

## Writing Content

### Quarto Markdown (.qmd)

Basic syntax:

````markdown
---
title: "Lecture Title"
---

## Introduction

Regular markdown text with **bold** and *italic*.

### Code Examples

```{{python}}
import numpy as np
x = np.array([1, 2, 3])
print(x.mean())
```

### Math

Inline math: $E = mc^2$

Display math:
$$
\frac{\partial u}{\partial t} = \nabla^2 u
$$
````

### Live Interactive Code

With pyodide filter enabled:

````markdown
```{{pyodide-python}}
# This runs in the browser!
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
plt.plot(x, np.sin(x))
plt.show()
```
````

## Features

### Navigation

- **Breadcrumbs**: Show current location
- **Search**: Full-text search
- **Table of Contents**: Auto-generated from headers

### Cross-References

Reference sections, figures, and equations:

```markdown
See @sec-introduction for details.

![Caption](image.png){#fig-diagram}

As shown in @fig-diagram...
```

### Callouts

```markdown
::: {.callout-note}
This is important information
:::

::: {.callout-warning}
Be careful here!
:::

::: {.callout-tip}
Pro tip: ...
:::
```

### Tabsets

```markdown
::: {.panel-tabset}

## Tab 1
Content for tab 1

## Tab 2
Content for tab 2

:::
```

## Building

```bash
# Render entire book
pixi run quarto render WebBook

# Preview with live reload
pixi run quarto preview WebBook

# Render single page
pixi run quarto render WebBook/Module1/lecture1.qmd
```

Output goes to `_build/book/`.
